messages.message: Hey everyone, some of you may have heard of this already, but I have been working on an Instabase CLI tool as a side project. This was born out of my frustration of writing UDFs on our website, and I was thinking that this would be a tool for our power users / Instabase devs. In the demo file you can see the current abilities - writing UDFs locally, executing them using the CLI or VSCode, seeing exceptions, and few other cool things. If you think this is useful or have any ideas, feel free to add to this doc: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1HfZsZFiuey81Wchz8H3PNalRl-9JtjdW4N42RoXtlxw/edit?usp=sharing
Next step is to add logging but I am still trying to find an efficient and secure way to do this

this is very cool! one feature that might be useful, if the function could be run locally, is to be able to start a local debugger to further debug the function (set breakpoints, inspect intermediate values, etc).

just for reference, one of my previous projects at ibm was a local debugger plugin for the ibm cloud function (apache openwhisk) cli. the general flow is to get the input from the server, run the function locally (in a docker container that has the same environment as the server), and point a debugger to it.

hereâ€™s a brief documentation:
https://github.com/apache/incubator-openwhisk-debugger/blob/master/client/README.md
